name: Adrienne's Overnight Barbecued Beef Sandwiches
author: PREGOCOOK
summary: Growing up, my Mom used to make barbecued beef in the crock pot and it always tasted so good.  It's definitely comfort food for me. After I got out on my own, I was determined to make barbecue beef just like hers, so I tried lots of recipes and finally came up with one of my own. I was so pleased! I called her to tell her and she laughed. She had always just used a bottle of barbecue sauce! We still laugh about that and now I've had to give her my recipe!
directions: Combine the onion, brown sugar, pepper, salt, chili powder, paprika, oregano, garlic, ketchup, water, white vinegar, canola oil, Worcestershire sauce, and liquid smoke in a slow cooker; stir
Lay the beef pieces into the sauce
Remove the beef from the sauce, keeping the sauce in the slow cooker, and shred with two forks
Remove 1/4 cup of the sauce from the slow cooker and pour into a bowl
Whisk the cornstarch into the sauce; stir the mixture back into the slow cooker
Serve hot on the whole-wheat buns
